On december 6, 2011
epoq
From epoq - Thursday 12 January 2012 at 15:30 (Added by 0ver2
Clans can face off against each other in the great Manamana wars! Here is how it works, and the rules:

Introduction

The king needs Mana , a rare form of energy, in order to bring stability to the dark world, and he is ready and willing to reward the clans that bring him the most mana. This is the resource which is to be collected and protected during the war. However, to increase their stocks of Manamana , clans only have one solution in this scenario: shake the very foundations of their enemies' castles!

To participate in the war, a clan must build their castle.
The registration fee allows you to build the castle and gets you 100 Mana points.

Do you have your eye on your neighbour's mana stocks? Get your hands on it by going to WAR! By making their castle quake, you generate energy Mana which will become yours if you win the war. The clan who destroys the enemy castle gets to have a quick look around their treasury, and pockets 5% of their Mana stock. The more Manamana a castle contains, the more Mana there is to be earned by attacking it.

Wars

War duration: 40 hours.
Wars can only be declared against clans with the same or less honour than you. (see Honour)
Wars are two-way events. A clan which is under attack can also attack their assailant's castle.
Do you have allies? Don't hesitate to call on them for help, but be warned, that could cost them valuable honour points, you will most likely need to make it up to them!
Transferring Dinoz Masters will no longer be permitted during the last 15 days of the War (only participating clans are affected)

Winning a war means you can keep the Manamana generated by breaking the castle's walls, and whoever delivers the killer blow will earn 5% of the defeated clan's Manamana stocks. There is no limit to the amount of Manamana that can be stored, your castle is big enough for everyone!

A war is lost if the attacking or defending clan's castle is destroyed. Rebuilding the castle is not automatic! You can leave the castle in that state until you gather your thoughts, or better still, come up with the best possible battle plan!

Be careful not to leave your castle in ruins for too long, as that will cost you honour points. (see Honour) You can rebuild your castle at any time by paying the rebuilding fees.

Do you fear the worst? Is this war going badly? It's a shame, but this time it is not possible to give up. So grit your teeth, defend your stronghold and wait for it to pass (or your walls to collapse)!

Have patience! you will have a short wait of 10 minutes between declaring war and being able to launch your first bloody attack.

If victory is not claimed by either clan (attacker(s) or defenders) before the war is over, the costs of the war are lost and the Manamana generated will vanish, never to be seen again.

The Castle

Unlike Clan Wars, the castle has no spells and no buildings.

However, there is one solution to regenerate the castle's hit points, repair crew Dinoz!

Have you got some great little Dinoz, but whose knees tremble at the sight of battle?

No worries! They can still be of great help to your clan: they can join the castle repair crew. Every Dinoz positioned at the castle will see the "Repair the Castle" option. As soon as they select this action, the dinoz will be attributed 'repair crew' status, and every hour, they will add 1 hit point to the castle. If the castle is destroyed, repair crew dinoz will no longer have this status.

To ensure that everyone isn't tripping over one another, there can only be 50 repair crew dinoz per castle.

When you add a dinoz to the repair crew, they will begin a repair task which will last 1 hour. When the hour is over, and the castle is still standing, 1 hit point will be restored and the Dinoz will continue repairing.

The castle can hold an unlimited number of defenders.

This time, the war has spread to formerly peaceful lands. Your castle can be build anywhere in the Kingdom of Dinoville, but also to the west of Dinotown: Dinoplaza and the Cinema Paradino.

Declaring Wars

In order to be able to declare war:

the attacking clan must not have declared more than 3 wars already today.
the attacking and defending clans must have castles (not ruins).
the attacking clan must have sufficient funds to declare war.
the attacking clan is not currently involved in another war they have declared.
the defending clan cannot have more points than you. (see below: Honour)

The cost of declaring war depends on the Manamana stocks in possesion of the attacking clan.

These fees will be paid using the ingredients in the clan treasury.

Honour

getting covered in dust and brick is all well and good, but the King wishes to reward only those who do it with class!

Each clan begins with 100 honour points and can accumulate up to 200. Every day, at midnight, the King goves 5 honour points to every clan whose castle is still standing. A Clan cannot declare war against a clan which has more honour points than they do. if they wish to attack this clan, they must regain honour points or be patient and wait a few days.

Actions affected by honour points:

Declaring war against a clan which is higher ranked than you will earn you honour points! (1 point per 5 places in the ranking, with a maximum of +10 points.)
in the same way, declaring war against a clan with a lower raking to you will cause you to lose honour points! (1 point per 5 places in the ranking).
Declaring war against a clan which is already under attack (helping an allied clan, for example) will cause you to lose honour points. The number of honour points you will lose will depend on the number of attacks currently in progress against the castle.
Declaring war against the same clan several times in one day will cause you to lose a lot of honour points (especially if you won the previous wars).
Declaring war against a clan you have already faced in the last 4 days will be considered as a grudge held against the opposing clan and will negatively affect your honour point score.
Every day that passes without declaring war will cause you to lose one honour point (cumulative). This also applies if the castle is left in ruins.


Honour point gains/losses will be stated when war is declared but before confirmation.

Battles

Battles are "to the death". There is therefore no need for a fight timer.
Survivors will leave the combat with the same number of health points as they had at the start. However, defenders only have one reduced means of recovery (see "Defending").
Survivors can re-equip with objects before attacking or defending again.
Attcks on a castle itself always cause 10 points of damage when inflicted by a Dinoz and 5 points for clones and reinforcements.
A 30 second delay is enforced after each attack to allow for injured Dinoz to be removed and healed.
The attacking group must wait 1 minute before attacking again.
There will always be a minimum of 3 defenders against any attacking group. (Even one solo attacker will face 3 defenders, and a group of 5 attacking Dinoz will face 5 defenders)
The defending group will consist of dinoz selected via the clan page. It will be made up of living Dinoz, in the order specified.
Battles earn for attackers.
Dead dinoz (attackers and defenders) are transported to their clan's castle and are healed to 100% of their . They will be given the status of recovering, which blocks all actions until the end of the current war (whether it is abandoned, won, or lost). If a Dinoz is recovering, they will be given an Irma's Potion disguised as a daily action.

At the end of a war, any Dinoz which dies in it will be healed to 100% and the recovering status will be removed. Any Dinoz killed while defending will be assigned to defend their castle. Any attacking Dinoz which are killed will be moved to their own castle.

Defending

A player can put an unlimited number of Dinoz in defence. However, during an attack, the player can only have 2 of their DInoz in the defending team on any given day.


Defenders have limited recovery potential. Each defender has 8 recovery points. When the defender participates in defending the castle, they will lose a recovery point. To regain this recover point, the defender must not participate in any battles for the following 2 minutes.

Once a defending dinoz has no more recovery points, they will progressively lose their ability to recover at the end of a battle in the following manner: 100%, 90% etc. etc. right down to 0% if they are on the receiving end of several consecutive attacks! If, between 2 atacks, 10 minutes elapse, the dinoz will recover 10/2 = 5 recovery points.

In short, as long as the defender isn't attacked almost constantly, they will continue to regain 100% of health lost at the end of the battle. However, if there is a massive invasion, little by little they will lose their ability to heal themselves at the end of the battle.

There is an obligatory 10 minute wait between removing a Dinoz from the defending team and being able to add it again
Enjoy the Mana War!














oldest post:
As most of you you know, the developers have been working on both a new war and COTC system. I hesitated to announce what the next big event would be, as I didn't want to announce something that wouldn't be ready.

After a meeting with them this morning, they told me that a new type of war is available, and that after a primary test on another server, the war system has once more been upgraded and should result in a really exciting war (rules to follow).

The help file will also be updated soon to reflect the changes.

SO...The FIRST MANA WAR will begin on the 14th of December and will last approximately 1 month.

There will be a Championship of the Clans (hopefully with the new system) around the end of January/ start of February.

I'm looking forward to seeing if there will be any more breakaway clans / clans downsizing / new alliances in this war which actively encourages clans to fight their equals. Down with bullying smaller clans! This is a war you can all get stuck into!

Epoq

zony
A cotc would have been more entertaining. Well well, mana war is better than normal war at least.

Imo the clan score should not only be the amount of mana in your clan's storage at the end, but also a part of the mana you had at every day.
Example:
@ the first day you have 100 mana. At the end of the day 10% of your days mana will be stored at an "untouchable" mana score pool (your clan's mana will stay at 100, but you will get 10 manascore points for that day). At the next day you have 150 mana and 15 get added to the score. At the end of the war your total score would be (current mana)+(mana score points).
Result: encourages every clan to gain as much mana as he can throughout the whole war -> more action.
Now if chaining isn't possible either, passive play won't be promoted anymore in the mana war and the fun can begin imo.

On january 12, 2012
epoq
Clans can face off against each other in the great Manamana wars! Here is how it works, and the rules:

Introduction

The king needs Mana , a rare form of energy, in order to bring stability to the dark world, and he is ready and willing to reward the clans that bring him the most mana. This is the resource which is to be collected and protected during the war. However, to increase their stocks of Manamana , clans only have one solution in this scenario: shake the very foundations of their enemies' castles!

To participate in the war, a clan must build their castle.
The registration fee allows you to build the castle and gets you 100 Mana points.

Do you have your eye on your neighbour's mana stocks? Get your hands on it by going to WAR! By making their castle quake, you generate energy Mana which will become yours if you win the war. The clan who destroys the enemy castle gets to have a quick look around their treasury, and pockets 5% of their Mana stock. The more Manamana a castle contains, the more Mana there is to be earned by attacking it.

Wars

War duration: 40 hours.
Wars can only be declared against clans with the same or less honour than you. (see Honour)
Wars are two-way events. A clan which is under attack can also attack their assailant's castle.
Do you have allies? Don't hesitate to call on them for help, but be warned, that could cost them valuable honour points, you will most likely need to make it up to them!
Transferring Dinoz Masters will no longer be permitted during the last 15 days of the War (only participating clans are affected)

Winning a war means you can keep the Manamana generated by breaking the castle's walls, and whoever delivers the killer blow will earn 5% of the defeated clan's Manamana stocks. There is no limit to the amount of Manamana that can be stored, your castle is big enough for everyone!

A war is lost if the attacking or defending clan's castle is destroyed. Rebuilding the castle is not automatic! You can leave the castle in that state until you gather your thoughts, or better still, come up with the best possible battle plan!

Be careful not to leave your castle in ruins for too long, as that will cost you honour points. (see Honour) You can rebuild your castle at any time by paying the rebuilding fees.

Do you fear the worst? Is this war going badly? It's a shame, but this time it is not possible to give up. So grit your teeth, defend your stronghold and wait for it to pass (or your walls to collapse)!

Have patience! you will have a short wait of 10 minutes between declaring war and being able to launch your first bloody attack.

If victory is not claimed by either clan (attacker(s) or defenders) before the war is over, the costs of the war are lost and the Manamana generated will vanish, never to be seen again.

The Castle

Unlike Clan Wars, the castle has no spells and no buildings.

However, there is one solution to regenerate the castle's hit points, repair crew Dinoz!

Have you got some great little Dinoz, but whose knees tremble at the sight of battle?

No worries! They can still be of great help to your clan: they can join the castle repair crew. Every Dinoz positioned at the castle will see the "Repair the Castle" option. As soon as they select this action, the dinoz will be attributed 'repair crew' status, and every hour, they will add 1 hit point to the castle. If the castle is destroyed, repair crew dinoz will no longer have this status.

To ensure that everyone isn't tripping over one another, there can only be 50 repair crew dinoz per castle.

When you add a dinoz to the repair crew, they will begin a repair task which will last 1 hour. When the hour is over, and the castle is still standing, 1 hit point will be restored and the Dinoz will continue repairing.

The castle can hold an unlimited number of defenders.

This time, the war has spread to formerly peaceful lands. Your castle can be build anywhere in the Kingdom of Dinoville, but also to the west of Dinotown: Dinoplaza and the Cinema Paradino.

Declaring Wars

In order to be able to declare war:

the attacking clan must not have declared more than 3 wars already today.
the attacking and defending clans must have castles (not ruins).
the attacking clan must have sufficient funds to declare war.
the attacking clan is not currently involved in another war they have declared.
the defending clan cannot have more points than you. (see below: Honour)

The cost of declaring war depends on the Manamana stocks in possesion of the attacking clan.

These fees will be paid using the ingredients in the clan treasury.

Honour

getting covered in dust and brick is all well and good, but the King wishes to reward only those who do it with class!

Each clan begins with 100 honour points and can accumulate up to 200. Every day, at midnight, the King goves 5 honour points to every clan whose castle is still standing. A Clan cannot declare war against a clan which has more honour points than they do. if they wish to attack this clan, they must regain honour points or be patient and wait a few days.

Actions affected by honour points:

Declaring war against a clan which is higher ranked than you will earn you honour points! (1 point per 5 places in the ranking, with a maximum of +10 points.)
in the same way, declaring war against a clan with a lower raking to you will cause you to lose honour points! (1 point per 5 places in the ranking).
Declaring war against a clan which is already under attack (helping an allied clan, for example) will cause you to lose honour points. The number of honour points you will lose will depend on the number of attacks currently in progress against the castle.
Declaring war against the same clan several times in one day will cause you to lose a lot of honour points (especially if you won the previous wars).
Declaring war against a clan you have already faced in the last 4 days will be considered as a grudge held against the opposing clan and will negatively affect your honour point score.
Every day that passes without declaring war will cause you to lose one honour point (cumulative). This also applies if the castle is left in ruins.


Honour point gains/losses will be stated when war is declared but before confirmation.

Battles

Battles are "to the death". There is therefore no need for a fight timer.
Survivors will leave the combat with the same number of health points as they had at the start. However, defenders only have one reduced means of recovery (see "Defending").
Survivors can re-equip with objects before attacking or defending again.
Attcks on a castle itself always cause 10 points of damage when inflicted by a Dinoz and 5 points for clones and reinforcements.
A 30 second delay is enforced after each attack to allow for injured Dinoz to be removed and healed.
The attacking group must wait 1 minute before attacking again.
There will always be a minimum of 3 defenders against any attacking group. (Even one solo attacker will face 3 defenders, and a group of 5 attacking Dinoz will face 5 defenders)
The defending group will consist of dinoz selected via the clan page. It will be made up of living Dinoz, in the order specified.
Battles earn for attackers.
Dead dinoz (attackers and defenders) are transported to their clan's castle and are healed to 100% of their . They will be given the status of recovering, which blocks all actions until the end of the current war (whether it is abandoned, won, or lost). If a Dinoz is recovering, they will be given an Irma's Potion disguised as a daily action.

At the end of a war, any Dinoz which dies in it will be healed to 100% and the recovering status will be removed. Any Dinoz killed while defending will be assigned to defend their castle. Any attacking Dinoz which are killed will be moved to their own castle.

Defending

A player can put an unlimited number of Dinoz in defence. However, during an attack, the player can only have 2 of their DInoz in the defending team on any given day.


Defenders have limited recovery potential. Each defender has 8 recovery points. When the defender participates in defending the castle, they will lose a recovery point. To regain this recover point, the defender must not participate in any battles for the following 2 minutes.

Once a defending dinoz has no more recovery points, they will progressively lose their ability to recover at the end of a battle in the following manner: 100%, 90% etc. etc. right down to 0% if they are on the receiving end of several consecutive attacks! If, between 2 atacks, 10 minutes elapse, the dinoz will recover 10/2 = 5 recovery points.

In short, as long as the defender isn't attacked almost constantly, they will continue to regain 100% of health lost at the end of the battle. However, if there is a massive invasion, little by little they will lose their ability to heal themselves at the end of the battle.

There is an obligatory 10 minute wait between removing a Dinoz from the defending team and being able to add it again
Enjoy the Mana War!

On january 12, 2012
Kayin
When attacking, what will happen:

- A lone dinoz will face 3 defenders.
- A group of 2 dinoz will face 3 defenders.
- A group of 3 dinoz will face 3 defenders.
- A group of 4 dinoz will face 4 defenders.
- A group of 5 dinoz will face 5 defenders.
No 1.3 defenders rules there.


While defending, on defense team:

In your defender pool, system will pick the dinoz in order you put them in, but as the rule state in a defense team you cannot have more than two dinoz from a same player.

ie: defense is listed as following:
PlayerADinoz1, PlayerADinoz2, PlayerADinoz3, PlayerADinoz4, PlayerADinoz5, PlayerADinoz6, PlayerBDinoz1, PlayerBDinoz2, PlayerBDinoz3, PlayerCDinoz1, PlayerCDinoz2.
- System will pick PAD1, PAD2, PBD1, if a group of 1 to 3 attackers.
- System will pick PAD1, PAD2, PBD1, PBD2, if 4 attackers, and will pick PCD1 as 5th for 5 attackers.

This rules was devised as such to counter one-man-defense.

Ok after re-reading.
Every clan can attack any clan, with these limitations:
- Haven't done its 3 wars (attackers only),
- Haven't a declared war (attackers only),
- Have the castle built (attackers and defenders),
- Have more honour or equal to defenders,
- And have enough in treasury (attackers only).

On january 18, 2012
Kayin
Actions affected by honour points:

Declaring war against a clan which is higher ranked than you will earn you honour points! (1 point per 5 places in the ranking, with a maximum of +10 points.)
in the same way, declaring war against a clan with a lower raking to you will cause you to lose honour points! (1 point per 5 places in the ranking).
Declaring war against a clan which is already under attack (helping an allied clan, for example) will cause you to lose honour points. The number of honour points you will lose will depend on the number of attacks currently in progress against the castle.
Declaring war against the same clan several times in one day will cause you to lose a lot of honour points (especially if you won the previous wars).
Declaring war against a clan you have already faced in the last 4 days will be considered as a grudge held against the opposing clan and will negatively affect your honour point score.
Every day that passes without declaring war will cause you to lose one honour point (cumulative). This also applies if the castle is left in ruins.
There's 14 clans who built their castle. So it doesn't explain how LOoT get 115 points in honour. Or else, the ranking is based on the initial clan creation. An older clan will gain easily reputation, huh?

TpackCZ
ad difference between using and abusing:
Abuse is the improper usage or treatment for a bad purpose, often to unfairly or improperly gain benefit. source: Wikipedia (I know this is not the best source to cite from, but to present common knowledge, this might be enough). So there does not have to be any problem with the rules in itself. Abuse is defined by gaining benefit by improper behavior. "Improperity" is based not only on the rules but also on ethics and common sense.

Its not my role to judge whether you crossed some sort of a line. I just wanted to say that your argumentation is twisted.

[939305]
Loopholes are illegal, no matter what people say... if legal, it wouldn't be called a loophole.
The thing is it is hard to say what is a loop hole and what not.

One theoretical example:
Clan A attacks clan B, but can not go through the defences. Neither can clan B on the counter. Clan C attacks clan A, but clan C is a weak clan who had no business being there. Clan A has neither the resources, nor the will to take down clan C, but will wait out the end of the war with clan A, and will take down clan C then. All this time, clan D, ally of clan B, wants to attack clan A, but can not do it without significant honor lost.
Now who is abusing? Clan A, because they don't take down clan C right away?
Clan C, because they did an attack without hope. Maybe even willingly to block out clan D? By the way, good luck proving something like this.

Another one:
Clan A know clan B will attack it during the day. So it lets it's ally, clan C, take his wall down to 10HP, so it will fall down giving clan C minimal mana. Clan C will wake up with a nasty surprise and a wasted attack. Is clan A abusing with this, is clan B abusing with this?

Yet another one:
Clan A is a very stong clan and attack Clan B. Clan B askes clan A to wait until they take down the wall of clan C, and promises to remove all defense in exchange.
So clan B gets some extra mana, which is unfair to his direct competitors, both clans spare some items and clan C gets destroyed in an attack that should not have happened, or even worse, which they would have indirectly won and received a little many from clan B.
Who is abusing?


The solution is actually simple, and here I agree with you: let the admins decide. From my point of view everything is fair until said otherwise (except real bugs of course, like mana appearing in your account while you do nothing, or your defence being invincible to do a bug), or nothing except everybody attacking everybody, putting in 100% effort every time is allowed.

"buddy-wars"
I would be interested when you consider something a "buddy war".
a) the defending clan does not fight 100% to defend its castle
b) the defending clan does not put in any defense at all
c) the defending clan agress with the attacking clan to let them live for a while so they can take out somebody else
d) the defending clan has an arragement with the attacking clan: they are destroyed each 3-4 days at regular, agreed intervals
e) the defending clan is an ally with the attacking clan; the attacking clan gets destroyed at regular intervals, but also carries out attacks together with the bigger clan against other clans

g) a variation of points d) and e) where repairers are involved

On february 9, 2012
[884767]
Wow.
Must be hard to try to develop a set of rules for this game, even more this server.
Basically, how do you create an event for a group of players where most of the top players are all stacked into a handfull of clans, and yet make it fun for the entire server?
If you just make it a normal war based on strenght and ressources, then the final ranking will reflect the usual ranking, and so the war is predictable. If you make more constraining rules to protect smaller clans or create upsets, then yes, people will be upset...
It doesn't help that top players are so little spread out, but then again, if you are in a clan that finish with top rewards each event, why would you leave?
A league system would be more logical, but we know that our server can't handle leagues, because no one would want to be in top league with the big canons.
So, back to square 1. I think MT is trying. I think the war was not so bad.
In fact, i think the initial rules worked pretty well, and the problems are created by the new rules: the +10 honor at reset, and the removal of the no-attack penalty. The only trouble with the initial rules was the DAY ONE blunder that should have gotten addressed pronto.

Anyways, here is for positive thining, what rules i like:
1- death is permanent for the war: makes it important to remove dinoz, gives power back to Scale, etc...
2- Full heal for defenders. Now defenders make a difference.

[884682]
I would say the honor system is good, but needs some changes:

1. those, who have a built up castle gain +1 honor for every 5 hours. - this would remove the quick rebuilds just before midnight

2. no honor gain for simply attacking somebody. honor is generated by time, and by won war. if you win a war against a lower ranked: 0 honor. if you win against a higher ranked (either by attack or counter attack) : you gain some honor. and if you was attacked and can defend yourself for a higher ranked: gain some honor

3. increase the penalty for attacking lower ranked clans: for example -1 for every 2 positions. (and this time the declaration of the war will give the honor penalty immediately!

4. the penalty for attacking the same clan: I would change to -20 for 3 days and -10 for the 4th day.

5. I would give a (maybe cumulative) penalty of -5 for attacking ANY clan, that lost a war in the last 24hrs.

these would be fair, but would lead to LESS war between the clans (0-1 for each day), and those would be fought between the same blocks (Every clan would fight with those are positionoed 3-4 higher and 1-5 lower, I think)

so those, who would like to fight LOTS would became bored.. but war would be again about planned attacks, not the opportunity-hunting..

Well that makes sense. How about a different approach.

Example new rule(s) as I see it:

If an attack is abandoned, the clan keeps the right to attack that same clan again after 4 days.
They are not allowed at all to attack that clan again until 96 hours expire (disable the attack entirely).

THEN if another attack is abandoned against the same clan, they cannot attack for 6 days ect... make it cumulative. At this time the attacking clan begins to lose honour by abandoning wars, 15 points each time.

If the attacking clan does not abandon an attack at any time, they lose the right to attack that same clan for the ENTIRE EVENT.

There would be no honour loss in either case, the ability to attack would instead be punished.

This will make them think about thier actions and how it affects them.

Would that not make it "fair"?
Would that keep "honourable" clans honourable, and "unorthodox" clans out of the war more days?

Again, if I see it wrong feel free to explain why. Ive no problem with that.

On february 21, 2012
[884682]
just a thought, not asuggestion: back in summer I've discussed with Jeno76 what would be a good war system (long before the current rules came out

- we've agreed that defense is the key part for this. it must be worthy to defend (and not by getting more

- the current system is good in that: dinoz not really die, so they can defend: if they are lucky, even repel some attackers!

- we were thinking about a system, where


1. the castle's defense limit could be set by the clan's owner

2. the level of the clan's castle would be a number between 20 and 50

3. this would be a value visible to everybody

4. the clan cannot put dinoz into defense with level greater than the level of the castle

5. the clan cannot be attacked by any team, that contains a dino with level greater than the castle's level!

(this value can be changed only a few times, f.e. once per week, and not be in effect immediately: like a 1 day cool-down, while there cannot be attacks or defenses involving the clan - so no quick changes would be possible) - rules like this (and others, I didnt think of) are have to be set/cleared..)

what would be the result of this?

- the war between the top clans wont be affected, I think. everybody would set their limit to 50, and all dinoz could take part as usual.

- the war between the mid clans are only affected by a bit: they would choose a number less than 50, so a weaker one could attack the stronger (mid clan) with full strength, but a clan that has 90% level 35 dinoz wont use its all-powerful top player to crush its equal level opponents with his 3 level 50s

- the war between top clans and mid clans would have the biggest difference: the weaker clan is unaffected, but the stronger clan would be limited to attack only with lower level dinoz. this would mean that either the top players would develop decent mid level dinoz too, or the not-so-top members of the clan would have to handle the mid clan's

so in this system:

- there will be much more interesting combats between mid clans and top clans (mid clans would have a chance against top clans, because their top dinoz (level 30-40) wont face full sphered level 50s

- there would be some strategy involved (setting the limit would need a wise decision)

- the mid members of the clans would have biggest role (now their role is "doing nothing"

this is just an idea, I think it never be coded in this game, I (we) were just wondering what would be a good system..
(for me the definition of the "good system" is the system, that makes the most player take part in the war)

+1 more idea to think about: (castle repairers -> healer dinoz)
- I think the castle's repair team was a good idea (something that involves dinoz, that cannot fight in the war)
- What would be if these dinoz would affect the healing of the defender dinoz? not auto healing, but (quick) healing based on the "healer" dinoz (like healing the defenders 1 HP / 30 seconds for every healers)
- I would maximize the number of defenders put in per player too (like 3 max)
- and this would be the max number of healers to (so a player could put maximum of 3 dinoz in the castle: either to heal the defenders or to defend
- a 50 member castle would have about 30-50 defenders and 100-120 healers maybe?
- the current delay of 1 attack / 30 seconds would work fine with them, and if somebody needs, there would be still opportunity to heal the wounded by bread and like..

these are - again - just ideas to try to make the clan war not to be a war between 5 member of a clan against 5 different player of an other clan..

what do you think?

-d2k-

On february 22, 2012
Piemaster
The issue is that you have two conflicting problems when trying to devise a fair system for war:

1. It is no fun for smaller clans to get repeatedly stomped over by clans they have no chance against.

2. It is not fair to penalise clans for getting stronger by forcing them to fight tougher opponents while lesser clans get easier fights and walk off with the prizes.

In the past we have had several attempts to solve #1 which have ended up as a fail because of #2. CotC1, CotC2 and CW5 (to an extent) are all examples of this in various ways.

There is only one idea I have had that manages to solve both of the above simultaneously. Have a war split in two halves, where the first half is fought as a regular clan war and the second half is divided into divisions depending on where you finished in the first half. But everyone in division 1 gets a better prize than everyone in division 2, who get a better prize than everyone in division 3 and so on. Not perfect, but might end up approximating a fair and interesting war.

ReiNijs
Defenders have limited recovery potential. Each defender has 8 recovery points. When the defender participates in defending the castle, they will lose a recovery point. To regain this recover point, the defender must not participate in any battles for the following 2 minutes.

Once a defending dinoz has no more recovery points, they will progressively lose their ability to recover at the end of a battle in the following manner: 100%, 90% etc. etc. right down to 0% if they are on the receiving end of several consecutive attacks! If, between 2 atacks, 10 minutes elapse, the dinoz will recover 10/2 = 5 recovery points.You just have to keep at it and hope that the opponent don't take you in this time I had my good share of BHs against LOoT, but it was fun so I did not mind - I think it was more annoying for them even.

On february 27, 2012
slyfox
Another little story I have for you.

At an old church the priest would turn up or down the thermostat every weekend. On Saturdays the first group of older women who came in would turn the thermostat up while the second group of younger women who came in would turn it down. On Sundays the first group that came in would turn it up and the second group would turn it down. This was just repeated non-stop each weekend, irregardless of the season.

One day the priest asked the congregation what is the ideal temperature of the church? A large portion of the group replied you should turn it up since warmer temperatures are better for older people with brittle bones and aching joints, and the older people make up the majority of the congregation. The rest replied that you should turn it down since it is far easier to put a coat or sweater on when it is too cold then it is to shed layers of clothes during the summer when you had no layers to shed.

The priest decided the best alternative was to leave the parish so he did not have to hear all these women whine all the time.

Take this game as this situation. You will never make everyone happy. It is impossible when the groups are so different. So I do not believe there are any real right or wrong answers.

I for one would like to see that for the next war:
1. mana gained from hitting walls is gone => should stop farming
2. clans should lose mana based on how many successfull defenses they have done, with a minimum(5%) and maximum(50%) => would force you to put up some defence, would reward you for holding out for a long time and would reduce the uber-usage of scouts/item drainers
3. auto-heal needs to be reduced; have a max number of free health points per dino that can be recovered in one war => reduces few stong dinoz based attack and defense
4. if more clans attack the same clan, no honor is lost, but the won many is shared between the involved clans according the number of attacks => should limit friendly blocking attacks, would encourage offensive alliances, but would limit the gain (thus you would use it on strong clans, but not week ones)

On february 29, 2012
Husaurus
Congratulations all. I would like to add some more suggestions:
If there are mana gains per war, they should be capped at something like 20% of the clan's current mana. The war should be a marathon and not a sprint.
If there are mana gains per battle, make them based on earned... and not based on wall kicks. This would mean a successfully defended wall can earn mana too.
The number of attacks on undefended walls should incur an honor penalty (or something) if there are not enough dead dinoz on defense.
End the bonuses/penalties for castles being up or down at reset... change it to a 6 hour castle auto-rebuild countdown from the moment the wall falls... this would spread out the wars throughout the day, add new strategic opportunities, and reduce the server load around reset.

On march 1, 2012
Sanjar
This war was an improvement in many ways and a step in the right direction overall. Many players have been waiting for a long time for penalty-free wars, where putting up dinoz to defend was a net gain for the clan and not a detriment to its growth.

Druid2k, Husaurus and others have made some excellent suggestions on how the new war mechanics could be improved. The one sentiment I feel must be highlighted is that the wars should be enjoyable for as many participants as possible. Without this, the strain on few members and boredom for most will severely impact the growth of this game in the long run. As a clan leader, one of the most difficult aspects of this game is to find suitable, meaningful and above all enjoyable roles for each clan member regardless of their level. So I implore MT to implement game mechanics and functions for these smaller members that make them important to the overall strategy, if not crucial. A clan will always have its smaller members, whether they are top 30 or top 3.

The second concern that needs mention is of course the viability of gaming the system versus the benefits of playing "normally". This will always be an issue with new systems, but I hope MT takes the suggestions in this thread and the strategies demonstrated during the war to develop a system in which the incentive for fun outweighs the efficiency of using unorthodox tactics. Not to say that coming up with those strategies isn't fun, but they shouldn't necessarily become a focus.

Speaking of strategies, we had a great time coordinating our bloc actions this war. Our intent was to make our presence known, and we accomplished that with good results. In the end, oldguard MK, GC and FETE had to show us upstart pups how it's really done, and I am glad you did not allow us to push you from your rightful spots. Our three clans got the spots we deserved this war. A heartfelt thanks to CoG's partners in crime, LBT and Voodoo. We have grown so much since we first started this bloc. I am proud to stand beside you. And the same to our friends elsewhere, you know who you are.

This has been a great first event for us. CoG would like to thank PL, Axie, DR, RA and FETE for the great fights. A special mention to Umpas for rejuvenating their fighting spirit, and standing strong alone. GDJ, you have and will always be our friends. ROoT, we'll give you a better fight next time around. DE, CB, thanks for the support. BBC, thanks for the surprise takedown, even though you accidentally finished us too early. VA, thanks for making our second to last operation exciting. And last but not least, congratulations to Cookies for their strong finish despite unfortunate early setbacks.

Here's to a nice long restful break for everyone.

On march 1, 2012
loam
Positives:
-Choosing your own ingredients. (and avoiding accidentally declaring war in one click, due to going through the process of picking the ingredients)
-Shorter war times (1d15h)
-Impossible to undeclared.
-Hypno is better.
-1-3 vs 3 is a nice measurement against overpowered brave attackers



Negatives:
-When you click to declare war, there should be a warning/notification if there is a change in the honor cost from when you click ‘declare’ to when you pay for the war.
-the way the mana war is designed, it becomes less about fighting and more about a mana collecting competition. This isn’t fun. There are some ways I can suggest to fix this, but I’m sure others can come up with better ideas.
1: bigger punishments for attacking the same clan. The four-day wait isn’t a long enough wait. Make it longer. (For example, we attacked umpa lumpa several times, which is no fun for them and left a bad taste for us, but because of the way mana war is designed, it was the smart choice for us at the time).
2: Less honor earned for staying up.
3: Shorter overall length. This is also a disincentive to attack the same clans repeatedly, as well as more fun in my opinion. How short? 3 weeks should be plenty of time and doesn’t allow people to sit at full honor long or at all.
-Clearly, no bugs. Start the event on a Monday and have the devs prepared to fix whatever bugs pop up during the day/week. At this point, we all expect bugs.
-I’m not sure I like the counter system as it is. It gives little desire to take a risk to try attacking a clan higher than you in strength, but lower than you in reputation. It is already disincentive enough by being stuck at war with them.
– Maybe make wars ending automatically at 0:00 no matter when it was declared. This changes the longest wars to lasting 24h.
-Black hole is too strong now.

[895738]
- poison should do either half damage in PVP or decreasing damage(halved after each damage) AND poisonite injection should negate 1 poisoning

You've forgotten to take into account smelly aura, which, although it only does 10 damage per cycle/battle turn for about 4-5 cycles/battle turns, triggers often and will make poisonites so redundant that anyone who hasn't got a santaz fetid breath/toxic cloud build will fall behind in any pvp fight.

In terms of adding a magic or normal item which negates BH, that's a good idea, but then again we negate BH.
And that's the problem with balancing this game: once something becomes OP, we either demand a nerf or a counter and then suddenly that thing is made redundant. I personally recommend some code/rule turning it off for any fights that do not have a timer, like the dojos and IDT. That way, BH is not a cheap way to win a long term battle which is prominent in sumo bubble dinoz.
